website_summaries.verdict: This cheap, yet effective inline vent fan is the perfect solution for DIY enthusiasts on a budget, and its fairly quiet, sturdy, and efficient design are well-worth the low investment.
pros: Power cord makes it easy to install
Long lasting fans and overall durable construction
cons: Not intended for use in areas with temperatures over 130 degrees, or high-humidity spaces

customer_reviews.title: Great booster.
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to what others have said, this booster is certainly 100CFM. This fan alone would be enough to ventilate a small seedling or early veg tent. I have my main inline fan pulling air in from the bottom of my large tent, sucking it out the top of the tent then blowing it into the bottom of the smaller seedling or veg tent. This booster then sucks the air out the top. This keeps my flowering tent perfect at around 73 degrees while the other tent is around 77. Both ideal for th usage of each tent.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: great for small to medium grow rooms.
customer_reviews.text: quiet, very low power usage, used as exhaust fan on a 6x5x6 grow room have had it running for almost 2 months straight with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Brock & Jess

customer_reviews.title: No!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. This is the third one I have ordered and it just seems to get worse and worse first one worked perfect so I ordered the second one, that one is ridiculously loud the third one doesn’t even push any air it is probably 5cfm you can’t hear it running because it’s not running st all
customer_reviews.author: Creativethinker

customer_reviews.title: Same size as the duct
customer_reviews.text: The fan motor was nice and quiet. However the end that exhausts to be plugged into my existing vent is the same size as the end of the vent. The minimal tapering is not enough to fit inside of the exhaust vent or over it. You will need to compress it or trim or find an adapter. Another make and model fit well the first time. So one star off.
customer_reviews.author: glandpuck

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these (intake & exhaust) and they are pretty good, doing the work just fine
customer_reviews.author: In Da Store

customer_reviews.title: Not the intended use, but it works.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to blow smoke into. Works well enough, nothing brag about. quiet hum, not noticable from the other room. It moves the air well. Hooked up to a dryer vent through the garage wall. It sucks out all the smoke if blown directly at the fan from 6 -8 inches away. Looking for something a little more powerful but it works for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: good quality and quiet
customer_reviews.text: these are more powerful and more affordable than the ones available at my local big box store. I have a pair of these that have been running 24/7 for over a year now and they still work perfectly. I invested in a couple more for a different part of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Peterson

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, Set at 50% very quiet, 100% is equivalent to a 300cfm at minimum setting,, 50% reduction in dB level. This fan does operate on a speed controller. CFM is enough for my 2x4x5 grow tent,, had a 300CFM on the same speed controller set to minimum, was over kill. Now my grow tent is no longer a vacuum chamber.
customer_reviews.author: BluesJamJim

customer_reviews.title: Dead in less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these on June 9, installed on June 11th. Been running in a normal humidity/temp environment and, yet, somehow one has died in less than 2 months. Discovered it yesterday, Aug. 10, so who knows when it actually crapped out, but here we are. While I wasn't expecting something at this price to last for years and years, I certainly had hoped to get more than 60 days out of it. We'll see how long the other one lasts, I suppose...
customer_reviews.author: Lili St. Cyr

customer_reviews.title: great little fan
customer_reviews.text: works great, have it set up with the Skylink Home SK-10 wireless motion sensor activated light lamp dimmer controllable receiver//the sensor runs the fan for 1 hour, have it set up in a cat box room exhausting though and external wall.
customer_reviews.author: Lokobous

customer_reviews.title: iPower GLFANXBOOSTER4 4 Inch 100 CFM Booster Inline Duct Vent
customer_reviews.text: Probably closer to 50 CFM, not expecting it to be around very long... It's not been in service very long but seems to be steadily losing it's power and thruput. Not ball bearing and don't expect to buy another one again. Hopefully the company reads reviews and offers something for resolution. It's fairly quiet for the short time it's been running, I'll give it that.
customer_reviews.author: Robertó Montalban

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have this thing airing out my grow tent, it fits nicely in the port and has been chugging along 24/7 since I bought it with no issues. If it last for a few months I would definitely buy again given the price when compared to more expensive options. The airflow is right where I want it, not ballooning my grow tent too much, and not so low I don't know it's there, you can hear it but it's definitely not loud.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: I added this inline booster to the bathroom exhaust tubing ...
customer_reviews.text: I added this inline booster to the bathroom exhaust tubing but it didn't make much of a difference in clearing out the steam. I added an outlet between the switch and the bathroom fan, then plug the booster fan in that outlet this way whenever I turn on the bathroom fan it also turns on the booster fan.
customer_reviews.author: Colin H- Long Island, NY

customer_reviews.title: Low air flow rate
customer_reviews.text: I plugged the unit in to see how much air flow it generated and the air flow was very minimal. I plan to return and get something with more flow.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan R. - Kennewick, WA

customer_reviews.title: Good for price, Invest in something better for grow tent ventilation
customer_reviews.text: For Grow Tent ventilation, i would probably recommend something a little bit more heavy duty unless you’re doing a small/micro grow. This fan is barebones, But with that being said, it seems to run very well and i don’t doubt that it will last a long time. i would recommend getting a dust filter to put on the end of this fan or on your ducting because dust can accumulate.
customer_reviews.author: abel eddington

customer_reviews.title: update on review.
customer_reviews.text: Update Update After the team saw my review they took charge and are offering me a full refund. Great deal. Good customer service. Sometimes things are faulty. Got the fan 4 days ago, the fan blade takes a couple seconds to get spinning when turned on. Then seems to be struggling spinning the whole time. Its noisy, and it vibrates pretty bad. All that I can deal with, but it moves hardly any air and I only have it on about 9 feet of ducting. I'm not buying the 100cfm from my experience, maybe 50.
customer_reviews.author: Smokey

customer_reviews.title: Weak Air Flow And Died First Use
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend it for venting a bbq smoker outside of the garage. The airflow was extremely weak and it died on its first use. It definitely couldn’t handle venting the smoke.
customer_reviews.author: SJJ

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size
customer_reviews.text: I got my "4 inch" in-line fan today..... except it was a 6 inch fan, labelled as a 4 inch fan.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Hudnall

customer_reviews.title: Nowhere near 100cfm
customer_reviews.text: There's little chance this fan actually pulls anything like 100 cubic feet per minute. More like half that. I was disappointed with my unit and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: TotesMcgoats

customer_reviews.title: not a high speed blower fan
customer_reviews.text: it worked perfect for the speed i needed. it was for the ozone generator, 4"pvc pipe with the cheap china ozone plazma generators, works fine for that speed but if you want a blower fan that actually blows air like for a fireplace wood stove, or a long distance where air flow is most important such as in cooling, get a differant one,
customer_reviews.author: brent fleming

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: It's weaker than it was promoted. However it's still okay to do the job I had in mind so I am keeping it. In the end, the price justified the quality. Although I do suggest seller to be more accurate to the specs.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Very small would recomend for micro grow or long ducting to keep air flowing
customer_reviews.text: Very small and wouldn't recommend for medium to large grow tents I would use it for a micro grow cause it doesn't move very much air at all but it's not to expensive and descent use much energy possibly would use if you have long ducting just to keep the air flowing
customer_reviews.author: #1 Honest reviewer :)

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: It worked for a while (a month) then died out. Doesn't put out a lot of air. Fan became noisey.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Awsome
customer_reviews.text: Great little fan. Works well inside small spaces to remove odors works great thank you
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Very low air movement.
customer_reviews.text: Well built but it hardly moves any air unfortunately. If I had to guess it is more like 25 CFM than 100. A hair dryer moves way more air than this does. I have it hitched up to exhaust through a plastic louvered dryer vent and it hardly moves the flaps.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Its very quiet. Had no problem hanging it in the germination tent to exhaust the excess heat. I can't speak to how much air it moves, but for a small germination tent, it appears to move plenty of air. Lets hope it lasts the growing season and I'll update if it fails.
customer_reviews.author: T. Richesin

customer_reviews.title: It died the first time we used it.
customer_reviews.text: It died the first day after installing it. Very disappointed. Installed after return window, so I'm stuck. Will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: gary d linton

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, Reliable
customer_reviews.text: This fan was perfect for my needs, it is very quiet compared to most others, but of course you can't expect it to be silent without designing your duct system around that. It moves a decent amount of air, if you need more go with the 6 inch. I don't think I could find a quieter fan at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas kaake III

customer_reviews.title: Works ok but seems less than 100cfm
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a small fume hood. Seems to do the job but doesn’t have a whole Lot of power. Given the price I am satisfied but if it cost more I would’ve sent it back
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Loud and ineffective
customer_reviews.text: It is loud and rattles it worked great the first 24 hours but now it’s barely moving air nowhere near 100cfm
customer_reviews.author: Valued Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice value
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased this fan to rig up a cheap small exhaust system for casting lead bullets. I used a dryer vent through my shop wall, this fan and a couple of 4" duct fittings. This works great.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: OK if you need to blow out a match.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, weaker than a folded paper fan. Not for high intensity anything, a 60w incandescent light-bulb maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Ehh, works, but expect to adjust it
customer_reviews.text: The fan blade was too close to the motor. Had to remove and make a spacer and then adjust the final location so that it wouldn't make a horrendous noise while in use.
customer_reviews.author: HenryK.

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: Check my math, but a four inch pipe would have to be about 1100 feet long to have a volume of 100 cubic feet. No way this fan is going to move 100 cubic feet per minute. Maybe 100 cubic feet per hour.
customer_reviews.author: Justanod

customer_reviews.title: Works prefect
customer_reviews.text: I have no issue with it. Alot cheaper than the local store. Nice and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: cheeseheadjf

customer_reviews.title: works nice, quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I added it inline to a duct that I connected to a box on my laser cutter to vent the fumes. worked just like I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good for a low lying fog machine cooler.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help move fog through my fog cooler. It works quite well. It pulls the fog through the ice covered ducting and does an excellent job.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C.

customer_reviews.title: but it does the job well enough and doesn't sound like a jet taking off
customer_reviews.text: very quiet. i used it to replace a bathroom exhaust fan lite combo that the wife said was way to loud. i just unplugged it and added this fan onto the duct. i doubt the cfm is 100. but it does the job well enough and doesn't sound like a jet taking off.
customer_reviews.author: charles cummins

customer_reviews.title: For the price it works.
customer_reviews.text: I have the 4” fan for an exhaust and while I’m not sure about CFMs, it does do the job. Currently it’s one timer so I can’t speak to the longevity but I can say it’s too loud and it does move air for what I need it for..
customer_reviews.author: DR. Greenthumb

customer_reviews.title: What sound?
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very very quiet! I came into my tent and had to turn it to see if it was on. I could not hear it. It was on. Great price! Great fan! NO SOUND!!! No debate!!!
customer_reviews.author: swanfamly

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Garbage do not buy can blow out a birthday cake candle
customer_reviews.author: Chris f.

customer_reviews.title: I’d recommend this fan for sure
customer_reviews.text: I rating is based on another fan I purchased here on Amazon. The other fan has twice the capacity according to its description. This fan pulls the same Amount of air as the other fan but it’s half the price. I’d recommend this fan for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Started clicking as soon as I plugged it in. Returned immediately!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't move air
customer_reviews.text: It only moves 5 or 10 cfm. Horrible will be returning
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Brown

customer_reviews.title: Arrived late
customer_reviews.text: Kind of loud no on and off switch short cord
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t move a lot of air
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t move a lot of air, some circulates back out of intake.
customer_reviews.author: Dinstar850

customer_reviews.title: Small but still noisy
customer_reviews.text: Too loud in any position after one week of use. Less loud upside down but you still hear clunk as if there is something loose or unbalanced. Useless and cannot seem to return without paying shipping. So wasted money
customer_reviews.author: Angela O

customer_reviews.title: I would look at other options
customer_reviews.text: -It was ok for the first 30 minutes then it just stopped working.. -The metal was bent all to hell when it arrived.. -Not much air flow.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Baugh

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Came on time amd good price, unfortunately it is not very goood as a booster , not much air flow
customer_reviews.author: Capt Jim

customer_reviews.title: Just make sure they do returns incase.
customer_reviews.text: The only positive was the noise level was low. Thats mostly because it didnt turn on im sure. Tried spinning it, nothing. Not worth my time to return, but this only took a minute. All i know is my product was defective. Took it apart and ill see what i can use elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Too noisy to be useful
customer_reviews.text: Super annoyingly noisy. Air output is just ok. So noisy it's not usable. Also no sensor so it's constantly on. Product is no good.
customer_reviews.author: Waiting to retire

customer_reviews.title: Quite running
customer_reviews.text: I use it on my dryer exhaust as I have a long run it cut my dry time in half it quite put switch to turn it on easy to install
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a month.
customer_reviews.text: Fan broke after about 30 days of usage. Didn't bother sending it back or anything just went with more of a quality inline fan. Steer clear unless you want a few weeks of usage out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: No regrets what so ever!
customer_reviews.text: This fan was delivered to fast!!! I got it even before it was promised! Works amazingly well and is the exact dimensions that were specified. Uses very little electricity and makes no sound at all. A buy that I will never regret! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Medlock

customer_reviews.title: Item
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was hopping for works and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T. Gregory III

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: ifffff any body tested this they knew it didnt work junk complete junk
customer_reviews.author: marco

customer_reviews.title: Quality product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I think it is a decent intake fan. But for exhaust I feel it's just not going to give me the amount of vacuum your looking for. Spend a little more if your serious. Or make shift your intake house hold fan, so the cfm are like 65ish to give your pressure in tent and fair balance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not strong
customer_reviews.text: I been trying to find a good fan for my craft room but couldn't find one. This one is also week. can't blow out the duct or smoke from my craft project.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Shorter than pictured
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive the item in the picture, which shows a booster fan that is 4 inches in diameter and 7.9 inches long. The one I received was 6 inches long. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Kessler

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful at all
customer_reviews.text: Really underpowered. It clearly says 100 CFM, my fault for not knowing that is like a light breeze
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, low CFM, but great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This had low CFM, though the reseller quickly and professionally resolved this. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for2months..
customer_reviews.text: After about 70 days it would start up making a horrible noise. Tried to return but NO reply from seller..
customer_reviews.author: xDOWNSOUTHx

customer_reviews.title: Very strong little vent fan for venting
customer_reviews.text: A lot stronger then I expected and quite quiet too. Works great for venting your grow tents
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so so
customer_reviews.text: works but not much flow....not really sure what i was expecting though
customer_reviews.author: snake

customer_reviews.title: a bad choice
customer_reviews.text: It was inexpensive but not worth even that. It is noisy and gets louder over time and it does not push much air. It lasted one winter but will need to be replaced at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden

customer_reviews.title: basic exhaust fan does ok
customer_reviews.text: works a little under power but that's what ya pay for I have it in a lower bathroom just to circulate air does ok job.....east to install.
customer_reviews.author: robert vanhevel

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely for very short amount of time.
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers mentioned, the fan gets a rattle in it. It still moves air but is very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Fisha lot

customer_reviews.title: Meh. It blows, but not all that impressive
customer_reviews.text: A bit doubtful on the 100 CFM in title. Feels like a gentle breeze coming out of the fan. Not all that impressive.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: I love them, well made, and good airflow.
customer_reviews.text: Great airflow been using for 2 weeks now no problems.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a little over a month
customer_reviews.text: Ordered June 1st. Died July 11th.....a week outside my return window. Loved it while it worked though.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Not completely silent but it hasn't made any annoying sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Did not last.
customer_reviews.text: Bought and installed less than 8 months ago and it has failed. It was a replacement for another which lasted years which I could no longer find. Will be trying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo

customer_reviews.title: Quite...easy install..great value
customer_reviews.text: I liked the ease of installation..didn't like I only bought one lol..Definitely could of used two.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Desjardins

customer_reviews.title: Have been using it constantly for over a year.
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job of moving air in my grow room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These two components do not fit together.
customer_reviews.text: This booster fan does not fit into the filter even though they are recommended to go together. A waste of time, money and energy. I guess it needs an adapter to fit together properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great... even being used with a Vivosun carbon filter. Says not recommended for that but have been running 24/7 for 3 months no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kris M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great but loud
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great for 3 months now it is very loud though but if it was in a duct it probably wouldn't be as bad
customer_reviews.author: Zion

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Much quieter than my metal bladed duct fans with comparable strength/flow. Fan is exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: tripleMonkey

customer_reviews.title: powerless
customer_reviews.text: Recommended to buy the 6 inch booster fan with used 6inch to 4inch round reducer or increaser.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Works As Described
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about a fan? Doesn't move a huge amount of air, but it's small and quiet. Has heavy duty cord.
customer_reviews.author: Killersax

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a timely manner and as described can't wait to use it !
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Weak fan
customer_reviews.text: This fan doesn't push it pull air. Terrible fan for grow tent intake. I will need to find something that can at least move air. A one cell organism produces more air flow sneezing than this fan.
customer_reviews.author: Roger MacDowall

customer_reviews.title: Runs pretty quiet I think
customer_reviews.text: Runs pretty quiet I think. Moves a nice little boost of air to my extra bathroom making up for the lack of airflow in that duct
customer_reviews.author: Ben wartgow

customer_reviews.title: great upgrade for exhaust problem of k40 laser
customer_reviews.text: great volume. used to suck exhaust for k40 laser. very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: gmart

customer_reviews.title: I power is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: Ipower is the way to go. Works even after long periods of time
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: Decent for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work ok for what I used it for. Not extremely powerful but it moves air between rooms
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ipower low noise and strong
customer_reviews.text: The Ipower is very well put also comes with aluminum blade not plastic so I don't have to worry about it breaking on me over time it also looks very strong thank you for very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Hellokimmiesfeet

customer_reviews.title: works great even just working it loose but secure in a ...
customer_reviews.text: works great even just working it loose but secure in a small grow tent in one of the precut holes. 2nd Ipower product Ive bought and been impressed with
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: This product showed up almost crushed and. When plugged in got hot. Started to smell and then qwit working would not waste my money buying
customer_reviews.author: Green starr

customer_reviews.title: quiet
customer_reviews.text: used the fan to increase kitchen heat flow. works great and sooooo quiet
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Good Fan
customer_reviews.text: Decent fan, just recieved it a couple days ago but I'm using it as an intake for my grow tent. So far so good 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Justin A.

customer_reviews.title: Died the next day.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fan strength and the length for the plug wire. I used it 6 hours the first day, but then it died the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: as described
customer_reviews.text: for my application in an 8x12 greenhouse works well. moves air quietly and not too much volume
customer_reviews.author: Dancing

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice little fan, really nice that it comes plug-in ready. Just using it to vent a small room.
customer_reviews.author: harold simengaard

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't move air.
customer_reviews.text: If you think you need 100cfm you need more than this fan will put out. Its weak.
customer_reviews.author: jonny

customer_reviews.title: Go for the bigger 6" duct fan if you want any sort of wind speed
customer_reviews.text: This small 4" duct fan was a big disappointment. It has very little power (can only feel fan on when placing my hand directly in front of it) when compared to the 6" size duct fan.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey D.

customer_reviews.title: This fan is basically just good enough for a fart fan
customer_reviews.text: Got this booster fan thinking it would help bring fresh air into a 3x3 grow tent...sorely mistaken. This fan is basically just good enough for a fart fan. Im returning it and ordering the Ipower 8inch booster fan.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen W

customer_reviews.title: Decent Fan for Price
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt move too much air. Have it running in a small 4x2x5’ tent, it gets the job done but i will be upgrading to a better fan soon. Fan is decently quiet and does a decent job overall
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Just a nice small fan to help move some air out of my basement
customer_reviews.author: roy schirmacher

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: As expected, pretty quiet. Used aluminum tape to adapt it to a soffit to use in a drop ceiling in a bathroom
customer_reviews.author: Sig Sauer

product_meta.title: iPower GLFANXBOOSTER4 4 Inch 100 CFM Booster Fan Inline Duct Vent Blower for HVAC Exhaust and Intake 5.5' Grounded Power Cord, 4", Grey
product_meta.description: Size:4" Fan4" 100 CFM booster inline Duct vent blower exhaust & Intake 5. 5' Grounded power cord HVAC Fans
feature_bullets: Specification: diameter: 4inch; Air flow: 100 CFM; Speed: 2930 RPM; Voltage: 110/120V; Wattage: 12W; Noise level: 40 db. Max operating temp of motor is 130℃ / 266℉; Max ambient temp is 60℃ / 140℉.
Application: help boost airflow in HVAC (heating, ventilation and air conditioning) units to remove exhausts and odors from grow rooms, kitchens, bathrooms, workshops, basements, attics etc.
Premium ventilation: quickly and efficiently move a vast amount of air; Temperature control-cooling rooms that tend to accumulate too much heat.
Advantages: superior balanced blades for long service life & quiet operation; Motor features a permanently lubricated bearing that operates quietly and requires no maintenance.
Note: if any other materials/particles get into the duct fan and get the blade stuck, users are to turn off the power immediately, clean it up, turn the power back on when handled properly.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars688 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
